summary.p: 148 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 17; Qurʾānic Text: Q 18:72-41:46; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 305 x 205mm; Script style: kūfī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 18f: "52 E. H. 17 Kur’an’dan bir bölüm. Parşömen. 205 mm boy 305 mm eninde cönk şeklinde 148 yaprak. Sahifede tahminen III. (IX) asır kûfisi ile 225 mm uzunl.[uğunda] 7 satır. Y. 1a ve Y. 147 b 148a da geçmeli ve hendesi şekilde müzehhep 3 levha vardır. Şemse ve miklepli kırmızı deri Osmanlı cildi. Bu mushaf Kahf (18) suresinin 72. ayeti olan قال الم اقل den başlamakta, Fuşşilat (41) suresinin 46. ayetinin sonundaki وما ربك بظلام للعبود de bitmektedir."

This can be translated as follows: "52 E. H. 17. A part of the Qurʾān. Parchment. 148 junk shaped leaves of 205 mm height and 305 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script of 3rd (9th) century [contains] 7 lines measuring 225 mm. There are three illuminated geometrical and interlaced plates in [Leaf] L. 1a, 147b and 148a. Ottoman red leather binding with flap (miklep) and a mandorla (şemse). The codex begins with قال الم اقل of Q 18:72 (Sūra al-Kahf) and ends with the words وما ربك بظلام للعبود at the end of Q 41:46 (Sūra al-Fuṣṣilat)."
